channel.title: Minimal damage, only applies to raiding, right?
channel.description:
I thought 'minimal damage' only applied to raiding, not to just flat out stealing and/or greifing of property for no good reason?
Like here: http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php/topic,501058.msg0.html#new
Why shouldn't that guy be rolled back and punished (though not severely)?

item.title: Minimal damage, only applies to raiding, right?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think it’s because we each have a different interpretation of what ‘minimal damage’ means. I for one see it as breaking blocks to get entry, but I’m guessing Corey was using this from the staff guidelines: “If a few blocks were destroyed, or if they tried to ‘improve’ someone elses building, a simple verbal warning should be sufficient.” In which case I agree with him, there wasn’t much damage done and I don’t see why we should roll him back completely (possibly losing two days of work) for breaking a few torches and lanterns (if that’s really what he did)

item.title: Minimal damage, only applies to raiding, right?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If we allowed unlimited residence’s, sure. I don’t know, what do you guys think? I thing griefing should still be punishable.

Yes, without question. I can only protect literally 1/3 of my land. Minimal damage should only apply to raiding, you shouldn’t be allowed to destroy blocks which aren’t related to gaining access to someones compound.
